Reviews.Title: “Now a Motel 6, Gum on the headboard”
Reviews.Author: 7TroopCutCopyPaste
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on the price and OKAY-ish reviews on TA. Well we called to book and were surprised when they answered "Motel 6". Yes, this is now a motel 6. Despite our reservations regarding the change the lady on the phone assured us it was only a name change and was the same hotel - the Redwood Inn. We checked in late at night and were directed round the back of the hotel which was dark, dingy and closed off and not viewable from the road - a great place to do a drug deal I would imagine. There was a very sketchy guy with his hood up, smoking and lingering for about half an hour walking between the front doors of the rooms out the back. The front desk could not be viewed from this area and if you got into trouble you would be fairly screwed. It did not feel safe. The room was small, there was gum stuck on the headboard, the TV was ancient, the bathroom had cracked tiles, the counter top was wafer thin and the fridge froze our milk overnight so we couldn't have our own breakfast. This was overall a bad experience and I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel manager totally mistaken”
Reviews.Author: fran p
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week because of family business. we became known to the manager and were treated well. upon our return home we received a used, home made neck pillow sent from the hotel via the freight forwarding company across the street from the hotel. this was done on my credit card and without my permission. when I contacted the hotel manager she said the pillow was found in our room and I spoke to them and asked them to send it back to me as it was made by my grand daughter. well, it wasn't I to whom she spoke, the pillow is not mine and I do not have any grand children. the manager would not try to be reasonable that it was her mistake. so I'm out $17.00 and some grand mother does not have her hand made pillow. the fact the manager would use my credit card to charge this absurd incident is very upsetting to me and I question her integrity...it is nothing short of theft as far as I'm concerned. I am working w/Discover on the issue but the freight company who charged the shipping is not culpable in the transaction. be aware of with whom you are dealing when checking into this hotel...it is a very regrettable situation all around.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Value”
Reviews.Author: MarkyChina
Reviews.Content: The Napa Valley Redwood Inn is a basic motel with a swimming pool. The rooms had been recently painted, were clean and had all the required services. We were only staying for one night, prior to an early morning balloon ride and the hotel proved ideal for this purpose, however I'm not sure it would be ideal for an extended stay due to the size of the rooms. What the Napa Valley Redwood Inn provided was excellent value for money, in an area that is hugely overpriced, and it was easy to access the main road running up and down the valley. I do think that other reviewers should consider the room rate when writing about this hotel; no one can provide 5 star service and facilities at these prices but they do provide value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: nresende
Reviews.Content: We visit Napa at least once or twice per year. This was our first time staying at this hotel because the place we usually stay was booked, as were most others in the Napa Valley. For being an older hotel it was fairly comfortable. It was freshly painted and clean. The rooms are small but free of odors. The decor is definitely outdated. The pool area is clean, but there is no hot tub. Parking is free and easy and there is a strip mall and starbucks across the street. The location of the hotel is convenient because it is about 2-3 miles south of the beginning of all the wineries. Considering that this hotel was half of the price of the larger chain hotels it was a good value. We didn't spend a lot of time there because we were busy wining and dining, but I would stay there again under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnar
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled from L.A. to San Francisco having pre-booked all of our accommodations. There were 5 people in our party and none of us are hotel snobs by any stretch of the imagination. Everything was great until we got to The Redwood Inn, 'AWFUL' doesn't begin to describe it. This was the most expensive out of the seven accommodations we had booked and we expected a 'good' standard of hotel, boy were we disappointed. The walls were paper thin and we were forced to listen to a vicious row between a couple close by. The bathrooms had old brown exposed pipes under the basins and the bathroom linen wasn't much better. However the worst part was the 'bites' two members of our party came away with, probably from the 'crawlies' we had seen marching across the carpets earlier. There was the offer of a comlimentary breakfast when we booked but this had been withdrawn when we got there (probably by Health and Safety!). Had we not been so tired we definitely would have moved on. Fortunately it was for 1 night only. Quite honestly I cannot undertstand how this place remains open. There is nothing about it that I could recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: While this place isn't fancy by any means (one small step above Motel 6), it is clean and comfortable. The front desk staff (the guy that took my reservation over the phone, and the older lady that checked me in) are extremely friendly! Close by to everything. I will definately stay here again if giving the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tappan
Reviews.Content: Did I mention, DO NOT STAY HERE. I’m in no way a hotel snob and I’m generally pretty tolerant of lower end motels since I take a number of mtn bike trips/camping trips per year that include staying in smaller motels and even some hostels. … On to the review: The room had a VERY bad cigarette smoke smell which was exacerbated when the A/C turned on. (by the way, the motel controls the A/C, you have no control over room temperature). Regarding the smoke smell, if it wasn't so disgusting it would be comical since you're required to sign a release stating that if you smoke in the room, you're subject to a $250.00 cleaning fee!?! The carpet was dirty, so dirty that when you stepped in the shower, your feet left black marks on the shower floor! The next word I’ll use as a descriptor will be THIN, applicable to a number of items. 1st, the walls were paper thin. You could hear the television and conversations in the adjoining rooms. 2nd, the pillows were terribly old and thin, hard as a rock. 3rd, the floors for the rooms on the 2nd floor provided absolutely no sound insulation (you guessed it, thin again!). You could hear every step someone took above you as well as toilets flushing. 4th, the towels were so thin you could almost see through them. 5th, last but not least, the mattress was very hard and thin. You could feel the springs when you rolled over. Did I mention the train ….? That’s right, the train tracks run right behind this property. I could go on but you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: klyns
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently for one night. The room was adequate - clean but very, very small with two beds crammed in. Bathroom was dated and towels/linens were old and thin. We did not find any way to control the temperature of the room - other than closing the vent. Very few outlets for computer/phone chargers. We did not have issues with noise - as some other reviewers have had. Decent location. Staff was friendly. Price was inexpensive. This is good place to stay if you are looking for something very cheap and inexpensive but if you want something with a little more style and space, find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Valleybear
Reviews.Content: The reception employees were enthusiastic and friendly. It is in a good location. A spartan but decent continental breakfast. We stayed here the night before the Tour of Napa Valley bicycle ride. The facility is tired and should be remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient location, comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: misswhirledtraveler
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for two nights in late June. I booked through Expedia and got a great deal on our room for the weekend, when I thought it'd be near impossible to find an affordable and comfortable hotel in wine country. This place was such a pleasant surprise! The room was cozy and comfy. The first room we got had a broken refrigerator, and we had strawberries and wine we wanted to chill, but we just talked to reception and they switched us over, no questions asked. Our new room had some issues - the AC was extremely cold and we had no way of turning it down, and we did find a crazy big bug inside the bed cover (which we determined was NOT a bed bug, although it freaked us out at first, and it was already dead when we found it) - but we decided that since we weren't going to be spending that much time inside, we'd just deal with it. We slept well in our quiet room and enjoyed the pool, which was big enough to swim laps - the perfect way to unwind at the end of our day wine tasting and riding bikes in St. Helena. The breakfasts every morning were just right: a variety of bagels, jams and cream cheese, cereals of multiple varieties, apples and oranges, oatmeal and tea, milk, coffee and juice. The hotel is also in an unbeatable location - practically equidistant from St. Helena and Sonoma, within 15 minutes' drive of downtown Napa, and less than 5 minutes from Trader Joe's, where we stocked up on all our picnic supplies the morning of our bike ride. The hotel is easy to find and close to the freeway without getting freeway noise. Definitely a good value and we'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: GWMarcia
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a tiny room!! One "Queen" bed, more like a full bed. But, check in was easy and the room was clean. The towels are terrific!! Nice full spray shower,too. Quiet, pretty good location, just tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica W
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding a hotel to stay in while visiting Napa, because we waited to the last minute to book and it was also high season on a weekend. We called every hotel and all was booked solid and Redwood Inn had one opening left. So we got it. At first I was skeptical because it is a " outside" hotel meaning the doors are facing the outside and I am leary about staying at places like that. But we walked in and met Maggie a sweet sweet lady who helped us and gave us an amazing deal and helped us enjoy our stay even better. The rooms are small but just perfect since you'll only be sleeping there after a long day of wine touring, the bathroom was spacious and nice. The shower head had hard pressure which was so nice and felt so relaxing. Location is perfect and you can walk across the street to pizza, grocery store, and starbucks. The continental breakfast was good but what you would expect at any continental breakfast. Bagels, muffins, toast, cereal, coffee...etc... The pool is heated and this is fabulous since it was 55 degrees in the evening in August. Overall this place is great the only downfall is the walls are thin so if your on the first floor you most likely will here everyone passing by the door and people above you walking around. Everything else is great including the staff... so nice and friendly and our stay was Absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER STAY AT THIS DUMP!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaChappell
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Napa and traveled back for my nephew's wedding. I booked the Napa Valley Redwood Inn several months in advance, for obvious reasons. As it turns out, this "Inn" is the 40 year old Motel 6 with a new paint job and name. The rooms have not been renovated and are gross! We checked in to the Inn at 12:10pm. The desk clerk was a nice young woman who explained that the maids were at lunch and the room would not be ready for an hour or two. OK no problem, my husband and I went to lunch and visited his sister. We came back to the Inn around 2:30pm. I already had my room keys, so I went to the door and opened it up and Oh my God, what a mess!!! The smell was that of, I can't even describe!! My husband went to the front desk to inquire what was going on....only to have the old lady named Maggie, tell him that check in time was 3:15pm. My husband said fine, I'll be back then. Maggie then proceeded to tell him that he was not coming back for his room and leave now. When my husband explained to me the situation, I went to the office to inquire what the problem was. Maggie told me that she did not like his attitude. (Hello what attitude?) This women Maggie should be fired!!!!!!! When I asked for my copy of the room charge, she said I have your copy right here, picked up the phone and proceeded to call the police. WOW! Thank God not everyone in Napa is as nasty as her. Karma will get her!!! She is the one with the attitude that she had the power to mess up your stay and leave you stranded. Well you know what Maggie......I appreciate you being a very nasty person, because we found a better place to stay (The John Muir Inn)!! Not only did I get a better room, it only cost a few bucks more that your DUMP!! Everyone reading this....stay at the John Muir Inn, you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel! Good location!”
Reviews.Author: celiamobilia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night! The staff were very helpful in putting together transport to the winerys as we had no tour organised prior to arrival! The lady on reception reccommended some fabulous winerys! She also sent us to a lovely restaurant that evening for dinner! Room was clean with all ammenities! Would stat here again if I return to napa!

Reviews.Title: “Good-Value Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ghsfcal
Reviews.Content: Not fancy but friendly management and clean rooms. Proximity to wine country and other area attractions means you aren't likely to spend much time in the room anyway. And price tag is much more reasonable than most other area accommodations (also will take one-day weekend reservations unlike many B&Bs and other hotels). Small swimming pool comes in handy on warm summer days. My wife and I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down but Okay”
Reviews.Author: mops1234
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay here during the Memorial Day weekend. The room was dingy, small and the carpet was a bit worn. Overall, the room was run down. We found the motel staff to be friendly. The continental breakfast was definitely nice to have. Besides coffee, tea, and toast, there were pastries, cereals, oatmeal, etc. They even have small trays for you to use so you could bring your breakfast items back to your room. Thought the price for the room was a bit high for what we received. On the fence if we will go back again. Would defintely go back if they cleaned up the rooms a bit.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN NAPA”
Reviews.Author: BugBay
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the redwood inn, the worst thing about this hotel is the people that work there. i had called from my room to the front desk for questions regarding good restaurants. they were unable to help and was hung up on numerous times. I walked to the front desk as soon as i got there the old lady(general manager) said "you know what you ask to many questions i dont have time for your questions go ask someone who cares" i immediately asked for a refund and was told that i was "stuck here" DO NOT VISIT YOU WILL REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay EVER!”
Reviews.Author: TylaRae
Reviews.Content: I work for a Travel Agency, and placed a client at the Redwood Inn. She was extremely excited for her trip to Napa Valley, but soon that trip turned into a nightmare. They had construction going on at the time which was no big deal, but when the construction workers were getting ready to leave for the day they decided to stay after hours she was concerned when she witnessed them drinking and do drugs. She decided to leave the Hotel and was told she would get a refund of the two other nights she did not stay. When she contacted the Hotel to let them know of what had happened the Manager was extremely rude to her and hung up on her! When we tried to call to figure out what had happened we were also hung up on numerous times, when we asked for the Owners name!

Reviews.Title: “Very average place, but great people.”
Reviews.Author: avle1
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel, but the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. I spent two night here, Saturday and Sunday, pretty much on an off-season time of year. Thursday through Saturday nights are charged at a higher price than others, but it was the cheapest I was able to book online. There were a lot of other local hotel/motels but not with the convenience of online booking. I think anyone should be able to find a cheaper place by making a round of phone calls. My room was pretty generic. I could not find a personal safe or lock box in my room. The heater was tricky to use. It seems to turn it on, the knob turns all the way to right and runs until someone turns it back all the way to the left and a bit to right and then the left again. It was a little difficult. Breakfast was simple, some cereal, apples, pastries, and such. There's no place to sit for breakfast, so either eat it standing up, or bring it back to the room. The pool was closed when I was there. Temporarily? It was raining a bit. The vent in the bathroom echoes to other rooms. So I could hear other people when they talk loudly. It's also pretty easy to guess when my neighbor's toilets go off. Turning on the fan helps privacy a lot. There's a bunch of local businesses nearby, including several nearby supermarkets and domino's. So you'll never go hungry here. One complaint, it's nowhere near downtown, in case you wanted to walk to a bar. By car, it is only 10 minutes away if you have a designated driver. There's also a Massage Envy across the street if you wanted to spoil yourself. The television only picks up a few channels. Some of the listed channels seem to be dead, leaving you staring at a black screen. No adult channels. The lady gave me a passcode of wifi access, but I don't use the internet when I travel. The people at the front desk are superbly helpful. They helped me book a wine tour and directed me to the best places to eat. That extra bonus was great. Stay if you need that kind of service. Otherwise bargain hunters can find better deals.

Reviews.Title: “im a traveler and i would say this is the best people (esp. Manager Maggie and son) that could accommodate a foreigner.”
Reviews.Author: susan010811susan
Reviews.Content: its a cozy inn, but even far excellent than any other place to stay. In terms of service is concern they are excellent!!!!! :) I would recommend this place and would even go back next year as the Lord allows. Thank you very much Maggie- you're the best!

Reviews.Title: “Redwood Inn is the BEST place to stay in Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: 101Traveler034
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Redwood Inn in Napa. The commercial rates are GREAT! The front desk staff are FANTASTIC!! And the manager, Maggie, is just SUPER. She wants you to be happy during your stay at the Redwood Inn. In fact, she works overtime to make sure you are very HAPPY! Redwood Inn is the BEST place to stay in Napa!!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain motel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: AtascaderoVisitor
Reviews.Content: I spent three weeks at the Redwood Inn while attending training during the week and sight seeing on weekends. Comfortable and close to many great restaurants where you don't have to spend all of your money. It is near Hwy 29 at the North end of the city of Napa, and within 10 minutes of 20+ wineries and downtown. You get a free continental breakfast that is available from 6:00am to 9:30am. There is also a pool available. The decorations are a little outdated, but the room was spotless and had every convenience including a refrigerator and a microwave. You cannot find a friendlier or more helpful office staff. They are available at all hours and were helpful with restaurant recommendations and places to visit. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend their vacation or business dollar on their daily activities, and not on a room where they only spend a few hours each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mreinoso
Reviews.Content: When considering the price, there is nothing bad and everything good to say about my stay here. What a great location and price! The owners were VERY helpful and nice to talk to. Ive been all over the world, stayed in some amazing places, and I own a B&B in Portland Oregon. I did not expect to have a good experience when I booked it. But it was great considering the price. Dont believe anything negative about this place. Its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of the whole trip”
Reviews.Author: travellingManc_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled up to Napa from Monterey and had a voucher from a free paper for this motel, unfortunately the only room left was a two-bed room which meant there were no deals to be had. We don't know the area and were pretty tired by then so we checked in anyway. The room was a bit dingy, the air vents were noisy and the air cold, however we had been driving around northern california for two weeks so had seen more than one room like this. We got changed and went out for dinner-Frida's Mexican just over the freeway which was lovely-and back to get an early night. On our return we could hear a strange noise which turned out to be the next-door neighbour snoring, this was just one of the many noises to keep us awake most of the night. The people upstairs walking around most of the night-and the walls that creaked like a ship on high seas; the neighbour's morning ablutions heard clearly through the walls;the man singing Johnny Cash songs in the carpark at 6.3-am-the 1 inch gap under the door allowed that treat to be appreciated as though he was in the room with us. At 7:45am I gave up and had a shower-reasonable soap, old grey towels. On the other hand, the tv had HBO which was a treat for a Brit since we don't get to see this stuff for another 6 months..

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: VinoAmour
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to fine inexpensive hotels in Napa, California. The Redwood Inn fits the bill...offers pretty good value for money. It is not expensive and the rooms are fine. I have stayed there on a number of occasions because of price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Flea bag”
Reviews.Author: IrishmenRsexy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weekends ago with a big group of girls on a bachelorette weekend. I did not make the reservations, or I you can believe I would not have wasted a single dime on this dump. The room was incredibly small with 2 beds smashed against the walls and a narrow space between them to walk through. The heater was ancient and did not work well at all. The bathroom had a smell like rotten pipes but hell, I'd take a dump just about anywhere, and when I do, who would notice the smell? I didnt try the swimming pool, but after I had showered, the towels sure reeked of chlorine. Im pretty sure people live there, because at night when we all got ready to go out for drinks, people on the top floor had moved their tables and chairs out on to the balcony and were playing cards. One woman came around pretending that she was being friendly but as soon as she introduced herself, she stated that she was not feeling well and that she did not want to hear any noise tonight. The breakfast area was super tiny, 3 of us girls could barely move in it to get our tea and coffee. I told one of the girls, "I feel like I'm in the twilight zone here" and she said that was EXACTLY how she felt as well. If you want a daring adventure surrounded by weird people, then stay here and get to know the neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disappointed3380
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Napa yearly. I knwo the lodging has increased at a large rate and it would be enticing to reserve a room at NVRI. I will remind you of the cliche, "Sometimes you get what you pay for." I stayed for a few nights and they quoted me a very reasonable rate. I thought it was great. When I arrived at the Inn, my resrvation was canceled and they told me if I wanted it, the price was double. My arrival was after midnight so as you would imagine I was alittle stuck. The manager was extremely rude and basically said take it or leave it. I had no choice because I was going during a peak time and rooms usually are scarce. It got cool at night but the heater did not work in the room. I guess this is the place the party people stay because it was loud at night. When I approached her to resolve this at checkout, she walked away from me and let someone else check me out. As you can see, I am very displeased with my stay. I thank God I did not book my entire trip with the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist's horrible attitude”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rniadreamers
Reviews.Content: This is a basic one-star motel, but the receptionist's attitude was no star. When we called from downtown Napa to get directions to the motel, she told us that she didn't know how to get to the motel from where we were! so we ended up going into a store in Napa to ask for directions. When we checked in, her attitude was gruff. ( She does not belong in the hospitality industry; perhaps, a prison guard position would be better for her.) The room is a 1950s style place with a very basic, but clean bathroom. It is true that you do not control the temperature in the room. The break fast bar is okay, but be prepared to eat your breakfast in your tiny room because there are no tables. Also search hard for a clean tray to bring your food to the room as most of the trays were full of crumbs, and the cutting board for English muffins, etc. needed cleaning badly. Coffee was good, however.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Everywheretraveler
Reviews.Content: Although the room had quite a lot of wear and tear, it was clean and tidy. I agreed with the other review that the room was a bit warm. I wanted to leave my luggage at the hotel after check out but the clerk said there was no storage space. If you bought some wine, you might want to get a cooler and place it in your car. Overall, this place is all right for someone who does not spend much time at the hotel. The service was uneven. The first time I called to make a reservation, the phone rang for 5 minutes and no one picked up. When I got through, the clerk voluntarily offered me an AAA discount even without me asking. When I asked for area information, the clerk was totally uninterested in offering advice.

Reviews.Title: “Room Dirty and bad odor. Manager Rude: No Climate Control or Air-Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: ck20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights (not our choice, our employer did this through Expedia and paid an outrageous $150 per night + tax ($168). The hotel room is small and smells, HBO (Human Body Odor). The air-condition temperature was controlled by the manager. We came back on Friday evening after working in a trade show to find that the motel room temperature to be warm. I asked the manager to turn the climate control up; she told me that the temperature is already on high. Told her this is ridiculous because it feels like 90 degrees inside the room. The manager then told me to leave instead of trying to solve the problem. The same night we looked at our bed sheets and found dirt and/or little dead bugs and human hair. Since it was midnight and the manager’s office was closed, at this time, we decided to bring this to the manager’s attention next morning. We went to sleep in our clothes lying on top of the bed spread. At 10:20 the following morning we informed the manager of what we saw. She took a short tone with us and told us that she wanted us “out in 5 minutes” and that she would charge us the full 2 days even if we get out before checkout time (11:00 AM) at the end of the first days stay. This is plain thievery and so we insisted that the manager put this in writing, which she did not. So we took two sheets from the maids cart and changed the linens ourselves. Then we went and bought a large can of Lysol and sprayed down every surface in the room which helped somewhat with the order. I would never stay at this motel if this was a personal vacation and employer should never book their employees here. For $150/night, there are better choices elsewhere. The room was filthy and smelly. The bed-sheet was dirty and the manager was rude and scheming; attempting to cheat us out of what was paid for because of the mere voicing of a valid complaint pertaining to odor in the room and hair and bugs in the bed. This is THE WORST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED IN and I wouldn’t recommend it, except to someone that I didn’t like.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: stressbreak
Reviews.Content: One of the lower rates in Napa but I was a little nervous because of some negative reviews. However, I had a fine stay. The room was clean and neat and the staff was friendly, helpful and accomodating. The breakfast, though continental, was more than I had expected. The temperature (mentioned in one of the negative reviews) was not a problem in November but I could see how the A/C might be a little weak if it were hot out. All in all, I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a good stay...and close to the vineyards”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed here for one night. We looked for an affordable place to sleep in Napa. A very friendly gas station guy recommended us this Motel. And we were not dissapointed. It's for sure one of the cheaper choices around. We paid around 70$ (we had a coupon). Ok, the rooms might not be the biggest around, but for two persons more than enough. Room was non-smoking...didn't smell bad at all. Bathroom was clean too. Check-In was fast and friendly. This Motel is at a good location and feels very safe. There were quite some people in the Motel...family and kids too. No strange people. Pool area looked quite nice and was clean and nice just to sit too. In only a few minutes you can reach the vineyards. If you go there I recommend you the "Robert Mondavi" winery. Very nice setting, wine tasting good priced....very beautiful located. It's a great place! We really had a great day in Napa....everything nice, Motel and the vineyards. This motel is a great base to see the area around Napa. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Motor Inn”
Reviews.Author: Davidwithoutborders
Reviews.Content: Expected less so I was pleasantly surprised. Clean rooms, well maintained, nice pool. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and gave me a AAA discount without even asking for it. Internet access at reception desk with printing and HBO in rooms a nice surprise. Of course, this is a motor inn, so there was some noise from the next room, standing shower without bath and nothing special. But for the price, in Napa, it was enough. Recommended if you just want the basic, clean amenities for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CaAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Simply said - this motel was a disappointment. The outside looked fine; a decent place we thought. However, rooms smaller than any I have seen, not clean, and neighbors partying until 2:30-3:00 AM loudly. No one available in office to handle this. Granted, this was a 1-night reservation, and we were staying for the Napa Valley Marathon - just a disappointment all 'round. Sorry.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modest price and place”
Reviews.Author: kapre
Reviews.Content: The Inn was relatively kempt, towels and sheets were clean. Tiny room, but for $128/night at Napa, we thought this was a good deal. Breakfast was basic (cereals and some pastries), but there's a gourmet grocery across to get more food or coffee. Got pretty warm in our room in the afternoon and the air had no controls, so we just stayed by the pool area. Hotel is conveniently located, FWY 29 is just around the corner to get to the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: muhoops13
Reviews.Content: Definitely a decent stay for the money. Probably one of the cheapest hotels in the area. it's clean, decent pool (nice to enjoy after a hot day of touring the wineries), average breakfast, great location off of Hwy29 and to downtown Napa. Not romantic--wouldn't recommend to couples unless their primary focus is the wine. Great for a group of friends to stay. Rooms are small. Our room had a shower; no bath. People at front were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: TrishC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redwood Inn for 1 night in late June 2006. It is simple, clean lodgings in the very expensive area of Napa. It is nothing special, but in a very convenient location with easy access to everything. It was clean, there was no funky smells that you often get with similar levels of accomodation. It is right next door to the Cablis Inn which we stayed the following night and across the street from a small shopping mall where you can buy everything that you need for a day wine tasting. The free breakfast that they served was plentiful and quite good quality. Cereals, bagels, coffee and fresh fruit were on offer. I would definately stay here again as for the cost of around $85 per night it is great value. The only thing I would recommend is that you view the room as we did before you move in and check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, a rathole”
Reviews.Author: kidreid
Reviews.Content: For $125 a night, we expected much more. True, hotel prices in the overrated Napa Valley are beyond thievery, but the Redwood Inn was the Deadwood Inn as far as we were concerned. With temps at about 90-degrees outside, we needed our room air-conditioned. What little air-conditioning there was blew straight down outside the bathroom door and never reached the bed. We tossed and turned the whole night. The mattress was uncomfortable. The blanket and sheets were stain-spotted. The room was a filthy cracker box. Worst of all, the clientele seemed like the Trailor Trash Union was holding a convention. One guy looked like someone I have seen on "America's Most Wanted". Now that I think of it, I'm surprised they could even afford the $125 for a room, they way all of them looked. The next night we splurged for Embassy Suites at $300 per night. Hey, what's another $175 in Napa Valley?

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: stevenq
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Napa Valley Redwood Inn just for one night. Got in at midnight and there was only a young man with tatoos who had to wake up to greet me and give me the keys. The room is pedestrian, clean enough. There's a TV, fridge (which didn't work), and bathroom. The shower worked well enough, got me clean, can't remember if they supplied shampoo or not (I brought my own just in case). Checked out immediately after waking up, didn't bother with breakfast as I was in a hurry. I was on second floor (I requested it). Read other reviews of people complaining about noise on the 1st floor. It was nice and quiet, although I regularly wear earplugs when sleeping (even at home). I believe with my AAA discount my rate was well under $100, maybe in the range of $70-$80 for the night. For what I needed it for, Napa Valley Redwood Inn got the job done. I did see the pool as I had checked out the place well in advance to staying here for the night. The surrounding environs does not make the pool inviting. The building itself is old and is a musty green color. You are also very near to freeway. And the pool is right in front of the hotel which means every Tom, Dick, and Harry can see you which is not necessarily a good thing since the area is a little on the creepy side. Steven

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic lodging”
Reviews.Author: AliceWonder
Reviews.Content: We had to make a choice - are we paying for wine or for our pillow. We chose the wine! The Redwood Inn has a great location, you can get onto the 29 quickly. Across from it is a Peet's and a great supermarket. The room has a little fridge (very handy!) and a nice sized bathroom. We expected no frills and got just that, we wanted something decent and clean which did not break the bank - The Napa Valley Redwood Inn is perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and Don't stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ooblek
Reviews.Content: I'm not a terribly picky person, and when I'm getting an inexpensive room, I don't expect the same amenities as one would get at the Ritz, but I do expect cleanliness and friendly service. I stayed at the Napa Valley Redwood Inn because of the excellent reviews I'd read here on Tripadvisor, but I was completely disgusted. I would have been better off sleeping in my car. First of all, the room was absolutely filthy. There were stains all over the carpet, the sheets, the blanket (white, crusty ones I might add...), and the mattress. In fact, the mattresses were falling apart, and big sheets of fabric that lined the bottoms of them (yes both beds) were actually laying on the floor under the bed because they had rotted away. The mattresses were so stained that it almost looked as if they'd been in a flood or something. When we closed the door to the room, there was a large gap between the wall and the door. The shower had no latch, so when used, the shower door hung open about 6 inches and water sprayed all over the floor. The towels were very thin, and about as big as two hand towels put together. On top of this, the room smelled horrible. The worst part of this whole thing was that late at night, after being unpacked and having left our luggage open for several hours while we were out sightseeing, we came back to discover the room was infested with FLEAS!!!!! The next morning, we wanted to get out of there ASAP, but felt that the management should know that there was a flea problem in room 102. I quietly let the person on duty know. She rolled her eyes and said "It's going to be one of those days huh?" I asked if there could be an adjustment to our bill considering the flea infestation. She went to get the manager, who proceeded to YELL at me!!! She hinted that I was a liar, and was making up a story so I could get a discount. She was very, very nasty. I stayed calm and told her that I had heard excellent things about the hotel, but felt that if she was going to yell at her customers and call me a liar regarding a very real problem that I was trying to call to her attention, that I felt it was my duty to spread the word about my experience. Her response was "Fine - go ahead and do that!" So I am. And just a note - it's now 4 days later and I've finally arrived home. As I was unpacking I've already found 2 fleas that stowed away in my suitcase!

Reviews.Title: “Redwood Inn just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Suffice it to say, you get what you pay for. We stayed two nights. The hotel is inexpensive and rooms are small, though clean. It is located right next to the freeway, and with the paper thin walls noise was definitely an issue. The bathroom shower stalls have very little water pressure but lots of mold and rust. Our tv reception on night one was poor, so I spoke to the manager and he said "yeah, our satellite dish has been out for a couple of months." OK, so fix it. The second night the tv actually quit working so we had to pack up and move to another room. The heater in the room was hard to control so we slept either hot or cold both nights. I don't recall seeing an A/C unit in the room, so be aware of that. Perhaps scariest of all is the surrounding neighborhood. We went to a sports bar just down the road for a bite to eat and when we entered it was more like a biker bar than a sports bar. We eventually had to leave when the bartender and a customer started using vulgar profanity on each other and a fight ensued. If you are planning on staying on the cheap this is the place. But if you want a little more comfort, and feeling of safety, go down the road to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Napa Valley Redwood Inn. Our friends were staying up the road at an expensive hotel. We opted for the cheaper option, and couldn't have been happier about it. Freindly staff, clean room, and the pool was great. We were able to fill our fridge at the Trader Joes on the other side of the overpass, and we got our coffee at the Peet's next door. We have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargain for the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: NanaPapa74
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley Redwood Inn is the place to stay in Napa if you want to save your money for something other than just a bed to sleep on! We stayed here in August 2005, and at $80 night, this was a real bargain for the Napa Valley, and a very nice motel overall. Very friendly staff, and some nice extras such as hi-speed internet connection, mini-fridge, and continental breakfast. Everything, right down to the parking lot, was very clean! Rooms were small but comfortable. If you travel with your pet, NVRI is pet-friendly (but for those of us who don’t travel with pets, we were glad to find the rooms are kept clean and free of “doggie” odors!) NVRI is just minutes away from the Downtown Napa shopping district and numerous wineries. The front desk has discount coupons to some of the local wineries – I highly recommend V. Sattui Winery, about 10 minutes north in St. Helena. NVRI is also located just a few blocks from numerous retail shops and restaurants (Marie Callenders, Safeway, Starbucks, etc.). If you are planning a romantic getaway for a special occasion and your hotel room is a key part of your trip, this isn’t for you. But if you just want a place to sleep after shopping and wine tasting - clean, safe, quiet accommodations - this is the place to stay! AAA discounts available. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - value priced”
Reviews.Author: TexCatBird
Reviews.Content: Tourist office told me we couldn't find anything near Napa for less than $100 per night. They were wrong. After reading about this motel in trip advisor, we checked it out for ourselves. The Napa town center was only 5 minutes away. This motel is on same street (practically neighbors) of the Hilton Garden Inn and Marriott (both of which would certainly have cost over $100 a night). Easy access to Highway 29 that takes you to the abundance of wineries. Our visit was tremendously enhanced by the helpfulness of the young man behind the reception desk. We were given coupons for free wine tastings and tours at some of the best that Napa offers. He assisted us with directions and made us feel quite welcome. The room was small and clean, but we were only sleeping there. Had a bottom floor room so heard some overhead noise, but the noise wasn't a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value-clean, comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am used to room service and bell captains, but on short notice, this was all that was availabe. When we arrived, I was just hoping this place would be at least equivalent to a Travelogde, . I was very pleasantly surprised! The property was very clean, the rooms were even cleaner, and the staff was wonderful. The rate was very reasonable. There is a FABULOUS market across the street that has the best deli for packing a picnic lunch. The staff was great, when our bathroom light went out, there was someone at our door to fix it in less than three minutes. They even had menus from all the local restaurants to help us decide on where to eat! The only downside was the fact the pool is not heated and there is no spa, so just be prepared for a "refreshing" dip! We will stay here from now on. So, there were no bell captains or room service, but this a great value and more importantly a very warm and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the area”
Reviews.Author: laj_texas
Reviews.Content: The great thing about a hotel in Napa Valley is that you need only an economical, safe place to sleep. This hotel met all our needs. The hotel has basic amenities in the room, but there is HIGH SPEED INTERNET ACCESS without additional charge. The cables are available in the room. This was an absolutely excellent feature for the price in the area. There is also a little refrigerator in the room. The continental breakfast was nicely laid out.....cereals - about 4 kinds, coffee, oatmeal, bagels and cream cheese, sweet buns of various sorts, toaster for the breads, coffee, orange juice, English muffins, butter and jam, microwave for the oatmeal, etc. Mattresses were very firm. Rooms were cleaned very well each day. Only showers were available in our room. Registration staff were very hepful in getting a ground floor room. All Rooms are "non smoking." Pool is lovely and looks well kept. The hotel is host to lots of regular travelers, such as truckers and construction crews. There are a couple of nice coffee shops across the highway. There are also a couple of grocery stores and a Target right across the bridge. For the price, this was a value place to stay, given the area. We were there in late April and paid about $75 / night on average. Many of the other comparable properties were asking 100+ per night. If you are touring the wineries of the area, then you are hardly in the room....why spend more than necessary to meet the need? I can recommend this property if a basic hotel is what you look for during travels.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Cost effective Hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dctravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Redwood Inn at the end of March 2005 for a 3 night trip to Napa Valley. The hotel is located directly off of 29 at the Northern end of Napa and is one turn (and one traffic light from the main road). The rooms were very clean, and were perfect for my wife and I. The staff was very hospitable, and the hotel offers a free continental breakfast (pastries, bagels, cereal) and had complimentary high speed internet available as well (did not take advantage of it). In addition, the hotel has a very clean pool and well kept grounds and is near a cool local grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Out Standing A+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What and outstanding motel Napa Valley Redwood Inn is. Five of us stay at this motel every year in June for the Nextel Cup races. We have never in several years of staying here ever come back to a dirty room. The rooms are well kept, the pool is wonderful, the breakfest is all a person could want and more. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate is always ready. But most of all it is the people who run and work at this motel. They always have a smile and are very helpful. They have gone out of their way to send myself and daughter a copy of the sports section when the paper wasn't there before we had to check out. Now that is above and beyond for any motel to do. YES...we are already booked again for June of 2005 for five nights. WHY because they are the best place to stay...I'd say any who chooses to stay here will be more than happy with everything they have to offer. Carolyn - The Gordon Five

Reviews.Title: “Low Priced Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Redwood Inn in Napa for 3 nights. We were quite surprised how well kept this motel is and how clean for such a wonderfully low price for high priced Napa Valley. The complimentary Continental Breakfast was just fabulous. We will make this our "home" when in Napa.

HotelInfo.Name: Napa Valley Redwood Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3380 Solano Ave., Napa, CA 94558
